answers.answer: " I started feeling light headed, dizziness, nauseous, and loss of balance while standing and/or walking." has nothing to do with an eye exam or eye issues. You need to be evaluated by a medical professional. We cannot evaluate you over the Internet to determine the cause. Your blood sugars may be out of whack and/or you're experiencing cardio issues, etc. Get off the computer and go to the nearest ER. You shouldn't feel this way for 10+ hours. Good luck -

question: I got my eyes dilated today.  I am diabetic ans have diabetic retinopathy and mild cataracts.  I have had my eyes dilated in the past but I concerned this time. About half an hour after the exam, I started feeling light headed, dizziness, nauseous, and loss of balance while standing and/or walking.  Is this a side effect?  What should I do, it has been 10 hours?
title: Diabetes and Eye Care
